body.para: Am Sonntag, 20. Juli 2003 um 20:17 schriebst du:
Hey, I try to build perl from sources with the new 64bit Cygwin 1.5 prerelease. All the code that is failing is the perl code from the perl sources which is used to build Perl.

quote.quotepara: Use strict; # that way you must use 'my' to define all scalars

My %module = ( 'cygwin'=>'Cygwin' ); # note 'cygwin' My $var = $module{$^0} || 'Unix' # can't remember what special variable = # $^0 but note that since %module and # $var are in the same scope you should try not to name %module and $module bcos $module refers to an entry in the hash of %modules

body.para: Unfortunately, the static miniperl compiled with Cygwin 1.5 fails. It seems that every 'my' is treated like a '#' and so it is not visible.
P.S. please fix your quoting, these mails are archived and open to every harvester (that means, please don't include email adresses in the body of your mails!) -- =^..^=
